intro: Asarca besseri, commonly known as the Bessera sweetgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tundra or wetland habitats, thriving in cold climates with short growing seasons. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Asarca besseri is often used by Indigenous peoples for its medicinal and aromatic properties.
